body_html: @ruiann, it is likely the intermediates for training and evaluation are using up your memory (i.e. the temporaries). a 1080P image is quite large 24 MB or so for a 3 channel float image version, and those sizes propagate and snowball quite easily.
body_text: @ruiann, it is likely the intermediates for training and evaluation are using up your memory (i.e. the temporaries). a 1080P image is quite large 24 MB or so for a 3 channel float image version, and those sizes propagate and snowball quite easily.
body: @ruiann, it is likely the intermediates for training and evaluation are using up your memory (i.e. the temporaries). a 1080P image is quite large 24 MB or so for a 3 channel float image version, and those sizes propagate and snowball quite easily.
